column1: dk.seges.1_1.models.CPO.description;"The system has been developed by Aarhus University and SEGES and covers main diseases and pest in cereal crops.
The models have been developed for guidance related to leaf and stem diseases in cereals including
The system also includes models for pest control in cereals.
The models require information from field registration typically in the period from GS 30-31 to GS 65-71
(assessments of frequency of plants attacked) and for some diseases also precipitation is required
(days with more than 1 mm rain). Before getting information on need for treatments – information on crop
cultivars susceptibility and growth stage (BBCH) is required.
The growers need to check the crops at weekly intervals or as a minimum follow the risk based on precipitation
or regional monitoring data for risk evaluation. In the Danish system fungicides and dose rates are
recommended. In the IPM-decision system only a recommendation to treat or not to treat is given.
The models have been validated in Denmark and has also been tested in the Baltic and Nordic
countries. It is expected to be valid in the northern part of Europe
column2: given that the monitoring part of

column5: Murali N.S. & Boll P.S. (1995). Field Validation of a

reduce fungicide input in winter wheat
column2: winter barley and spring barley in Denmark.

dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.description;"THE PEST: Leaf blotch diseases of wheat can be caused by septoria tritici blotch (Zymoseptoria tritici) and staganospora nodorum blotch (Parastagonospora nodorum)
column2: which are both  favoured by wet conditions.

column1: THE DECISION: Fungicide treatments may need to be applied between stem extension and ear emergence
column2: mainly to protect the upper leaves.

column1: THE MODEL: The humidity model estimates risk of septoria tritici blotch infections in winter wheat. Risk of attack is assumed after 20 hours with continuous wetness. A wet hour is defined as minimum 0
column2: 2 mm precipitation in an hour or minimum 85% relative humidity.

column1: THE PARAMETERS: Weather data from GS 31 are used. In addition
column2: the dates of occurrence of growth stages 31 and 32 are entered. The model calculates the expected date for the other stages. This can be adjusted manually. Adding information on fungicide spraying dates is vital for the model. After spraying
column3: the model assumes that the crop is protected for 10 days. The thresholds for number of wet hours and relative humidity can be adjusted manually.

column1: SOURCE: Created by Aahus University and SEGES and released in Denmark in 2017. Tested in Lithuania
ASSUMPTIONS: septoria tritici blotch is present and periods with high humidity create risk for a damaging epidemic
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.execution.input_schema.properties.configParameters.properties.leafLifeTime.title;"Expected life time of a leaf (in days)"
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.execution.input_schema.properties.configParameters.properties.slidingHoursAhead.title;"Number of hours to consider after current hour"
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.execution.input_schema.properties.configParameters.properties.slidingHoursPast.title;"Number of hours to consider before current hour"
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.execution.input_schema.properties.configParameters.properties.sprayingProtectionDays.title;"Number of days the crop is protected"
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.execution.input_schema.properties.configParameters.properties.thresholdHumidPeriodHours.title;"Threshold number of hours for a 'wet period'"
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.output.result_parameters.HPHPP.description;"Humid period hour (consecutive humid hours) corrected for protection period"
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.output.result_parameters.HPHPP.title;"Humid period hour (consecutive humid hours) corrected for protection period"
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.output.warning_status_interpretation.2.explanation;"Based on current observations entered and weather data
column2: the risk of septoria is low.

column1: dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.output.warning_status_interpretation.2.recommended_action;"Continue to check for risk updates and monitor crops. Update crop growth stage and date of fungicide applications through the season"
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.output.warning_status_interpretation.3.explanation;"Based on current observations entered and weather data
column2: the risk of septoria is moderate."

column1: dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.output.warning_status_interpretation.3.recommended_action;"If the threshold of 20 hours humidity is not  exceeded
column2: but other diseases are assessed to also cause a risk and the crop has not been treated in the last ten days
column3: choose an effective fungicide which also covers  control of septoria.

column1: This model runs March-June.  Continue to check for risk updates and monitor crops. Update  crop growth stage and date of fungicide applications through the season."
dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.output.warning_status_interpretation.4.explanation;"Based on current observations entered and weather data
column2: the risk of septoria is high."

column1: dk.seges.1_1.models.SEPTORIAHU.output.warning_status_interpretation.4.recommended_action;"If the crop has not been treated against septoria in the last ten days
column2: treat according to need. Choice of fungicides depends on the general disease risk. Apart from effectiveness on septoria the product should also account for other risk factors/diseases.

column1: This model runs March-June.  Continue to check for risk updates and monitor crops. Update crop growth stage and  date of fungicide applications through the season."
